info.title: Enabling IPv6 router advertisement for PXE clients

abstract.para: This section describes how to enable basic IPv6 router advertisement and address assignment functionality for PXE and HTTP Boot clients for host IPv6 auto-configuration.

note.title: Only required in IPv6 or dual-stack networks
note.para: Configure IPv6 router advertisement only if PXE clients are expected to receive IPv6 addresses or operate in an IPv6-only or dual-stack environment. For purely IPv4 deployments, this step is not necessary.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: To support PXE booting in IPv6-enabled environments, the PXE server may provide basic router advertisement functionality to inform clients of the network prefix. However, in production networks the router is usually a separate machine.
